title: Are you planning on putting up a Christmas tree in 2020? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. Over the years, we’ve downsized our Christmas tree to a tabletop size. We get a fresh one every year—and they’re hard to find, btw. We’ve gotten them at Whole Foods, and two years ago started getting nicer ones at a local nursery. We put mutti-color lights one it and a small star on top (that I have attached to a chopstick I painted green one year, and tie it onto the tree with a green twistee). We still have our family ornaments, collected over the years, but we no longer use them. We get our tree in mid-December, or a little later, and are able to enjoy it until the 12th Day of Christmas, i.e., Epiphany. And fwiw, we celebrate a minimal Christmas at our house. And we consider it a secular holiday—the season and the day itself. My husband and I are empty-nested and retired, though we are involved with some non-profits. With the pandemic going on, we work with those remotely and socially distant. So we hope we won’t be pushed by family into getting together inside for Christmas the way we usually do. Still, it’s hard to say no to something so important to others. Anyway, we want our tree just for us to enjoy.

We haven’t set up a Christmas tree for the last 4 years. But being 58 & 61 without family nearby, why?!? We buy items throughout the year as needed. 🤷🏼‍♀️ We both miss celebrating Christmas, but as we are approaching retirement age, we have cut back on many frivolous purchases. We have two 4 year old cats that have never experienced the Christmas tree. I’m not sure if that is good or bad! 🤣. We DID downsize to a 4-ft pre-lit tree, but have yet to erect it at Christmas. 🤷🏼‍♀️ To answer your question, we probably won’t set up a tree this year, as we would like to move as soon as my husband gets a new position.

Absolutely; in fact, this might be the first time in YEARS we do a real tree instead of our artificial one, because we’ll be spending more time at home to enjoy it instead of attending various parties and get-together all over all month. Almost all of our shopping will likely be online and shipped directly to recipients, so that’s less time shopping and wrapping, more time to soak up the ambience of our home.

There’s just me and my cat—so, yes, I plan on putting up my tree this Christmas. At my age, I owe myself an indulgence of beauty and a reminder of why we have Christmas at all. Most folks seem to forget the reason for the season—it’s become a season of commercialization, and that’s so unfortunate. As a reminder to anyone who cares: Commerce did NOT build this event even though it takes advantage of the main event. Had it not been for Christ, it is doubtful that man would be here at all.

No, I am Jewish and never put up a tree. However, we will decorate with poinsettias and centerpiece and I plan to get a natural wreath for my door. We also put all our gifts from friends and each other on the fireplace hearth (we don’t use our gas fireplace til later in the winter) and open them on Christmas morning. I am thinking of doing takeout from a restaurant for Christmas dinner. In other words, we do a secular celebration.

Yes of course I am, Christmas is not the same without the tree. Typically we shop for a real tree but last year the pickings were slim so we bought a nice artificial one. I lit a pine smelling candle to add to the ambiance and although it is not the same it still turned out pretty nice. Thanks for the question.
Of course i am, just because family getting together is probably not going to happen you should make the most of what you can do and give thanks for that xx.
Yes, absolutely! I love decorating the house and creating a festive atmosphere. It’s much needed, especially this year since my family will be stuck at home.
Yes of course Christmas is not Christmas without a tree. Of course it will be the same artificial tree as in years past with the same decorations as ever, but there will be a tree.
